name: [Gen 9] Random Battle
desc: Randomized teams of Pokémon with sets that are generated to be competitively viable.

name: [Gen 9] 1v1
desc: Bring three Pokémon to Team Preview and choose one to battle.

name: [Gen 9] 2v2 Doubles
desc: Double battle where you bring four Pokémon to Team Preview and choose only two.

name: [Gen 9] National Dex BH
desc: Balanced Hackmons with National Dex elements mixed in.

name: [Gen 8] JolteMons Random Battle
desc: Pokémon, items, abilities, and moves are redesigned for OU, and new items, abilities, and moves are added, all without changing base stats.

name: [Gen 9] Tier Shift
desc: Pokémon below OU get their stats, excluding HP, boosted. UU/RUBL get +15, RU/NUBL get +20, NU/PUBL get +25, and PU or lower get +30.

name: [Gen 9] The Card Game
desc: The type chart is simplified based off of the Pokémon Trading Card Game.

name: [Gen 9] Almost Any Ability
desc: Pokémon have access to almost any ability.

name: [Gen 9] Balanced Hackmons
desc: Anything directly hackable onto a set (EVs, IVs, forme, ability, item, and move) and is usable in local battles is allowed.

name: [Gen 9] Mix and Mega
desc: Mega evolve any Pokémon with any mega stone, or transform them with Primal orbs, Origin orbs, and Rusted items with no limit. Mega and Primal boosts based on form changes from gen 7.

name: [Gen 9] Godly Gift
desc: Each Pokémon receives one base stat from a God (AG/Uber Pokémon) depending on its position in the team. If there is no Uber Pokémon, it uses the Pokémon in the first slot.

name: [Gen 9] STABmons
desc: Pokémon can use any move of their typing, in addition to the moves they can normally learn.

name: [Gen 9] NFE
desc: Only Pokémon that can evolve are allowed.

name: [Gen 9] Camomons
desc: Pokémon have their types set to match their first two moves.

name: [Gen 9] Convergence
desc: Allows all Pokémon that have identical types to share moves and abilities.

name: [Gen 9] Cross Evolution
desc: Give a Pokémon a Pokémon name of the next evolution stage as a nickname to inherit stat changes, typing, abilities, and moves from the next stage Pokémon.

name: [Gen 9] Fortemons
desc: Put an attacking move in the item slot to have all of a Pokémon's attacks inherit its properties.

name: [Gen 9] Full Potential
desc: Pokémon's moves hit off of their highest stat.

name: [Gen 9] Inheritance
desc: Pokémon may use the ability and moves of another, as long as they forfeit their own learnset.

name: [Gen 9] Partners in Crime
desc: Doubles-based metagame where both active ally Pokémon share abilities and moves.

name: [Gen 9] Pokebilities
desc: Pokémon have all of their released abilities simultaneously.

name: [Gen 9] Pure Hackmons
desc: Anything directly hackable onto a set (EVs, IVs, forme, ability, item, and move) and is usable in local battles is allowed.

name: [Gen 9] Revelationmons
desc: The moves in the first slot(s) of a Pokémon's set have their types changed to match the Pokémon's type(s).

name: [Gen 9] Shared Power
desc: Once a Pokémon switches in, its ability is shared with the rest of the team.

name: [Gen 9] Tera Donation
desc: The first Pokémon sent out immediately terastallizes. The other Pokémon in the party inherit that Tera Type as an additional type.

name: [Gen 9] The Loser's Game
desc: The first player to lose all of their Pokémon wins.

name: [Gen 9] Trademarked
desc: Sacrifice your Pokémon's ability for a status move that activates on switch-in.

name: [Gen 6] Pure Hackmons
desc: Anything that can be hacked in-game and is usable in local battles is allowed.

name: [Gen 9] Mix and Mega Cup
desc: [Gen 9] Challenge Cup with the Mix and Mega mod. The only items are mega stones, Primal orbs and Rusted items.

name: [Gen 9] Random Battle Mayhem
desc: [Gen 9] Random Battle with Team Preview and elements of Camomons, Inverse, Scalemons, and Shared Power.

name: [Gen 9] Computer-Generated Teams
desc: Teams generated automatically based on heuristics (rules), with levels based on previous success/failure in battle. Not affiliated with Random Battles formats. Some sets will by nature be worse than others, but you can report egregiously bad sets with this form.

name: [Gen 9] Hackmons Cup
desc: Randomized teams of level-balanced Pokémon with absolutely any ability, moves, and item.

name: [Gen 9] Doubles Hackmons Cup
desc: Randomized teams of level-balanced Pokémon with absolutely any ability, moves, and item. Now with TWICE the Pokémon per side!

name: [Gen 9] Broken Cup
desc: [Gen 9] Hackmons Cup but with only the most powerful Pokemon, moves, Abilities, and items.

name: [Gen 8] Random Battle
desc: Randomized teams of level-balanced Pokémon with sets that are generated to be competitively viable.

name: [Gen 8] Battle Factory
desc: Randomized teams of Pokémon for a generated Smogon tier with sets that are competitively viable.

name: [Gen 8] BSS Factory
desc: Randomized 3v3 Singles featuring Pokémon and movesets popular in Battle Stadium Singles.

name: [Gen 8] Super Staff Bros 4
desc: The fourth iteration of Super Staff Bros is here! Battle with a random team of pokemon created by the sim staff.

name: [Gen 8] Hackmons Cup
desc: Randomized teams of level-balanced Pokémon with absolutely any ability, moves, and item.

name: [Gen 8] CAP 1v1
desc: Randomly generated 1v1-style teams only including Pokémon made by the Create-A-Pokémon Project.

name: [Gen 8 BDSP] Random Battle
desc: Randomized teams of level-balanced Pokémon with sets that are generated to be competitively viable.

name: [Gen 7] Random Battle
desc: Randomized teams of level-balanced Pokémon with sets that are generated to be competitively viable.

name: [Gen 7] Battle Factory
desc: Randomized teams of Pokémon for a generated Smogon tier with sets that are competitively viable.

name: [Gen 7] BSS Factory
desc: Randomized 3v3 Singles featuring Pokémon and movesets popular in Battle Spot Singles.

name: [Gen 7] Hackmons Cup
desc: Randomized teams of level-balanced Pokémon with absolutely any ability, moves, and item.

name: [Gen 6] Battle Factory
desc: Randomized teams of Pokémon for a generated Smogon tier with sets that are competitively viable.

name: [Gen 1] Hackmons Cup
desc: Randomized teams of level-balanced Pokémon with absolutely any moves, types, and stats.

name: [Gen 7] Monotype
desc: All the Pokémon on a team must share a type.

name: [Gen 8] Monotype
desc: All the Pokémon on a team must share a type.

name: [Gen 8] 1v1
desc: Bring three Pokémon to Team Preview and choose one to battle.

name: [Gen 8] ZU
desc: The unofficial usage-based tier below PU.

desc: Bring three Pokémon to Team Preview and choose one to battle.

name: [Gen 7] ZU
desc: The unofficial usage-based tier below PU.

name: [Gen 2] Nintendo Cup 2000
threads: • Differences between Nintendo Cup 2000 and GSC OU

name: [Gen 1] Japanese OU
desc: Generation 1 with Japanese battle mechanics.

name: [Gen 1] Tradebacks OU
desc: RBY OU with movepool additions from the Time Capsule.
